headline: Cast Iron Chicken Fajitas
description: Cooking the chicken in a cast iron skillet results in mouth-watering fajitas. Don't skip the marinating! Serve with tortillas and your choice of toppings.
name: Cast Iron Chicken Fajitas

recipeInstructions.text: Combine olive oil, lime juice, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Add chicken breast and toss until well coated. Cover bowl and refrigerate, 4 hours to overnight.
Heat a cast iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken breasts to the hot skillet, reserving the marinade. Cook until browned, 6 to 8 minutes. Remove chicken from skillet, slice, and set aside.

Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in the same skillet and add onion, bell peppers, and reserved marinade. Cook until vegetables are soft and tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Add chicken back to the skillet, stir, and cook until warmed through, 2 to 4 minutes.

review.reviewBody: This came out perfect. We kept it simple with just salsa, sour cream and shredded cheddar for toppings!
Very good chicken fajitas. Will make them again.
Best Fajitas weâ€™ve ever had. I did cut up the chicken before marinating. Fantastic ðŸ’•

I've made chicken fajitas several times but came across this recipe and thought I would try it just because. I was only able to let my meat marinade for about an hour but I was still highly pleased with the flavor. This is also a great starter recipe for chicken fajitas.
Very good but I didn't have any limes. I always have limes.

Excellent fajita/fajita marinade recipe! Started marinade at noon & sautÃ©d up at 6pm. Only change: sliced the chicken breasts before putting them in the marinade for 1) get marinade saturated into every bite, and 2) save a step later after removing the chicken and adding the onions/peppers. Red onion is a must for me and fajitas. ;) Served with guacamole and Spicy Quesadilla Sauce from this site. Outstanding! Thanks Yoly!
WOW! Absolutely delicious. Better than a restaurant. I added chopped cilantro and flambÃ© 2 tablespoons of tequila at the end before serving. Scrummy ..... make it!!!!
